summary.purpose: Provides geographic utility functions for calculating distances between coordinates and generating Google Maps URLs.
summary.problem_solved: Centralises haversine-formula distance calculation and Google Maps link generation for use across services.

external.name: akeyless-types-commons
external.why_used: Provides the Geo type ({ lat: number; lng: number }) used in function parameters.

exports.name: get_distance_in_meters_between_geo_points
exports.description_one_line: Calculates the distance in meters between two geographic coordinates using the haversine formula.

exports.name: get_location_url
exports.description_one_line: Generates a Google Maps URL for a given geographic coordinate.

symbols.name: get_distance_in_meters_between_geo_points
symbols.description_one_line: Calculates the distance in meters between two geographic coordinates using the haversine formula.

params.name: location1
params.description: First geographic point with lat and lng in decimal degrees.

params.name: location2
params.description: Second geographic point with lat and lng in decimal degrees.

returns.description: Distance in meters between the two points.

details.what_it_does: Implements the haversine formula using Earth's radius of 6371e3 meters to compute the great-circle distance between two lat/lng points.

minimal_correct.title: Calculate distance between Tel Aviv and Jerusalem

symbols.name: get_location_url
symbols.description_one_line: Generates a Google Maps URL for a given geographic coordinate.

params.name: location
params.description: Geographic point with lat and lng in decimal degrees.

returns.description: A Google Maps URL string pointing to the given coordinates.

details.what_it_does: Constructs a Google Maps search URL using the format https://www.google.com/maps?q={lat},{lng}.

minimal_correct.title: Get Google Maps URL for a location
minimal_correct.code:
const url = get_location_url({ lat: 32.0853, lng: 34.7818 });
// url => 'https://www.google.com/maps?q=32.0853,34.7818'
